tests.title: Mathematics Quiz - Algebra Basics
tests.description: Test your understanding of basic algebraic concepts including linear equations, expressions, and problem solving.
tests.instructions: Read each question carefully. Show your work where applicable. You have 60 minutes to complete this test. Calculator is not allowed.
tests.subject: Mathematics

questions.question_text: What is the value of x in the equation 2x + 5 = 13?
questions.explanation: Subtract 5 from both sides: 2x = 8, then divide by 2: x = 4

questions.question_text: If y = 2x + 3, what is the value of y when x = 4?
The slope of a line passing through points (2, 3) and (4, 7) is:

tests.title: Science Test - Physics Fundamentals
tests.description: Comprehensive test covering basic physics principles including mechanics, forces, and energy.
tests.instructions: Answer all questions. Use the formula sheet provided. Calculator is allowed for numerical problems. Show your work for full credit.
tests.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: What is the SI unit of force?
questions.explanation: The Newton (N) is the SI unit of force, named after Sir Isaac Newton.

questions.question_text: According to Newton's first law, an object at rest will:

options.option_text: Remain at rest unless acted upon by a force

questions.explanation: Newton's first law states that objects at rest stay at rest unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

questions.question_text: The acceleration due to gravity on Earth is approximately:
questions.explanation: The standard acceleration due to gravity is 9.8 m/s² or 9.81 m/s².

questions.question_text: If a car travels 100 meters in 10 seconds, its average speed is:
The formula for kinetic energy is:
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy equals one-half times mass times velocity squared.

tests.title: English Literature - Reading Comprehension
tests.description: Test your understanding of literary devices, themes, and reading comprehension skills.
tests.instructions: Read the passages carefully before answering. Support your answers with evidence from the text. No outside materials allowed.
tests.subject: English Literature

questions.question_text: In Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet, the two feuding families are:
questions.explanation: The Montagues and Capulets are the two feuding families in Romeo and Juliet.

questions.question_text: What literary device is used in 'The wind whispered through the trees'?
questions.explanation: Personification gives human characteristics (whispering) to non-human things (wind).

questions.question_text: The main theme of George Orwell's '1984' is:
questions.explanation: 1984 explores themes of totalitarian government control and constant surveillance.

tests.title: History Test - World War II
tests.description: Comprehensive examination of major events, causes, and consequences of World War II.
tests.instructions: Answer all questions in complete sentences. Provide specific dates and examples where possible. Use proper historical terminology.
tests.subject: History

questions.question_text: World War II began in which year?
questions.explanation: World War II began on September 1, 1939, when Germany invaded Poland.

questions.question_text: The D-Day invasion took place in:
questions.explanation: D-Day occurred on June 6, 1944, on the beaches of Normandy, France.

questions.question_text: Which country was NOT part of the Axis powers?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union was part of the Allied powers, not the Axis powers.

tests.title: Computer Science - Programming Basics
tests.description: Introduction to fundamental programming concepts and terminology.
tests.instructions: Code examples are provided. Trace through the code carefully before answering. No external resources allowed.
tests.subject: Computer Science

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a programming language?
questions.explanation: Python is a popular programming language used for various applications.
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, used for creating web pages.

questions.question_text: In programming, what is a variable?

options.option_text: A fixed value that cannot change
A storage location with a name and value that can change

questions.explanation: A variable is a named storage location that can hold different values during program execution.
